planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun. It has a very thin atmosphere and its surface temperatures can vary drastically, from extremely hot to extremely cold.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and is similar in size and structure to Earth, but it has a thick, toxic atmosphere that traps heat, making it the hottest planet in our solar system.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known planet to support life. It has a diverse climate and surface, with vast oceans and a variety of ecosystems.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun, known as the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide on its surface. It has the largest volcano and canyon in the solar system.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in the Solar System, a gas giant with a massive atmosphere composed mainly of hydrogen and helium. It has a Great Red Spot, which is a giant storm.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun, known for its extensive ring system made of ice and rock particles. It is also a gas giant and has numerous moons.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and has a blue-green color due to methane in its atmosphere. It has a unique tilt, rotating on its side, and faint rings.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun in the Solar System. It is similar in composition to Uranus and is known for its strong winds and storms, including the Great Dark Spot.
